data.text: Its the ammonia in the sealant that breaks down some of the adhesives that hold different plies of the tire together. This more commonly happens where its hot and humid. What has worked for me in the past is to use a needle and pop it like a blister....it will most likely be water inside. Just be careful not to go all the way through, just a surface hole where the bubble is. Should be fine after that.
